intro: Sparattosperma vernicosum, commonly known as the hairy-stemmed spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers in clusters, typically green or yellowish in color. The plant is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
